channel.title: Comments on: Direct Download Of Flash For Mac OS X

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/09/01/direct-download-of-flash-for-mac-os-x/#comment-4248">Lance Willett</a>.
I'd like to do that, except I use Chrome as my main browser and I don't want to have Flash enabled on my main browser. Using Flash is an exception, not the rule.
Hmmm, I wonder if I could selectively turn Flash on just on certain sites.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lance Willett.

I’d like to do that, except I use Chrome as my main browser and I don’t want to have Flash enabled on my main browser. Using Flash is an exception, not the rule.

Hmmm, I wonder if I could selectively turn Flash on just on certain sites.

item.title: By: Lance Willett
item.dc:creator: Lance Willett
item.description: Better yet: remove Flash completely from OS X and use Chrome for any Flash needs as it's built-in and auto-updated in that browser.
item.content:encoded: Better yet: remove Flash completely from OS X and use Chrome for any Flash needs as it’s built-in and auto-updated in that browser.
